text:
Man bashed in front of wife at Bruce Springsteen gig 'asked fan to stop swearing' Yahoo7 News Share Share Wagga Wagga man bashed in front of his wife at Bruce Springsteen gig after asking fan to stop swearing - Yahoo7 A Bruce Springsteen fan says he was attacked in front of onlookers at a concert, after he asked a drunken man to stop using foul language. Close Springsteen fan beaten in Hunter Region UP NEXT VIDEO Springsteen fan beaten in Hunter Region. Source: 7 News Springsteen fan beaten in Hunter Region Don Elphick and his wife travelled from Wagga Wagga to see Bruce Springsteen perform in the Hunter Valley last weekend, but the trip of a lifetime quickly turned nasty. An intoxicated man allegedly attacked Mr Elphick at the Hope Estate concert, after he was asked to reconsider his language. The man who allegedly lashed out after being asked to stop swearing. Picture: 7 News “He has grabbed me, taken me to the ground and started choking me and punching me in the head (sic),” Mr Elphick said. The man allegedly continued to hit the defenceless Mr Elphick as his wife tried to get help. Mr Elphick and his wife reviewed the attack footage. Picture: 7 News “I was nearly hysterical to see (the attack) happening,” Mr Elphick’s wife Angela said. “He couldn’t breathe, to see someone hit him where you know he has got an injury… It was just really traumatic to see them doing that to him.” Mobile phone footage captured the moment the man lashed out, allegedly punching Mr Elphick. Picture: 7 News Mr Elphick was taken to Maitland Hospital where he was treated for a concussion and shoulder injuries. Mrs Elphick has slammed security at the concert, claiming only one guard responded to the cries for help. Angela Elphick has slammed the security response to the attack. Picture: 7 News “I could see Don slowly starting to struggle to breathe and the security guard ran away… he actually turned and physically ran,” she alleged. The security company hired for the event says it is investigating the assault. Police are also investigating the assault.
